greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Array read by antidiagonals: T(n,k) is the number of noncrossing partitions up to rotation composed of n blocks of size k.
comment: Also, the number of unlabeled planar k-gonal cacti having n polygons.
The number of noncrossing partitions counted distinctly is given by A070914(n,k-1).
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1274
Miklos Bona, Michel Bousquet, Gilbert Labelle, Pierre Leroux, Enumeration of m-ary cacti, arXiv:math/9804119 [math.CO], Apr 1998.
Index entries for sequences related to cacti
formula: T(n,k) = ((Sum_{d|n} phi(n/d)*binomial(k*d,d)) + (Sum_{d|gcd(n-1,k)} phi(d) * binomial(n*k/d, (n-1)/d)))/(k*n) - binomial(k*n,n)/(n*(k-1)+1) for n > 0.
mathematica: T[n_, k_] := (DivisorSum[n, EulerPhi[n/#] Binomial[k #, #]&] + DivisorSum[ GCD[n-1, k], EulerPhi[#] Binomial[n k/#, (n-1)/#]&])/(k n) - Binomial[k n, n]/(n (k-1) + 1);
Table[T[n-k, k], {n, 0, 12}, {k, n, 1, -1}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 22 2018 *)
results.author: _Andrew Howroyd_, Apr 28 2018
